041103BE47DB42AE872F2589A0AD16F9.description: Combine clauses in a wide variety of ways (e.g., rearranging complete simple sentences to form compound sentences) to make connections between and join ideas (e.g., The boy was hungry. The boy ate a sandwich. The boy was hungry so he ate a sandwich) in shared language activities guided by the teacher and independently.

07CE6EB645644B5AAE5A9C32082E9AC5.description: Combine clauses in an increasing variety of ways to make connections between and join ideas, for example, to express cause/effect (e.g., She jumped because the dog barked) in shared language activities guided by the teacher and with increasing independence.

B9ACD11BE62C488E8E3B41CC459C8E5B.description: Combine clauses in a few basic ways to make connections between and join ideas (e.g., creating compound sentences using and, but, so) in shared language activities guided by the teacher and sometimes independently.

A6D850C01E8144DCB6C6F47ABF42610D.description: Expand simple and compound sentences with prepositional phrases to provide details (e.g., time, manner, place, cause) in shared language activities guided by the teacher and independently.

9803C79F3BFF4525992F413BDBE24C94.description: Expand sentences with prepositional phrases to provide details (e.g., time, manner, place, cause) about a familiar or new activity or process in shared language activities guided by the teacher and with increasing independence.

73DEA337C16844BB828D685A0952BA7C.description: Expand sentences with frequently used prepositional phrases (such as in the house, on the boat) to provide details (e.g., time, manner, place, cause) about a familiar activity or process in shared language activities guided by the teacher and sometimes independently.

29937B3914C74A5ABA8C3246F4135018.description: Expand noun phrases in a wide variety of ways (e.g., adding a variety of adjectives to noun phrases) in order to enrich the meaning of phrases/sentences and add details about ideas, people, things, and so on, in shared language activities guided by the teacher and independently.

5F4D89CF793D431C80F199427547B84B.description: Expand noun phrases in a growing number of ways (e.g., adding a newly learned adjective to a noun) in order to enrich the meaning of sentences and add details about ideas, people, things, and so on, in shared language activities guided by the teacher and with increasing independence.

E5CAFA3229194AE8B9A673B5AD17AC29.description: Expand noun phrases in simple ways (e.g., adding a familiar adjective to describe a noun) in order to enrich the meaning of sentences and add details about ideas, people, things, and so on, in shared language activities guided by the teacher and sometimes independently.

22B7145FE1D54D0EAC3559C2521BE5CC.description: Use a wide variety of verb tenses appropriate for the text type and discipline to convey time (e.g., simple present for a science description, simple future to predict) in shared language activities guided by the teacher and independently.

B15A4FDD11BD49CEBBB49721069508BF.description: Use a wide variety of verbs and verb types (e.g., doing, saying, being/having, thinking/feeling) in shared language activities guided by the teacher and independently.

8E1C6DCA73574E7693491BFE65E26FBD.description: Use a growing number of verb tenses appropriate for the text type and discipline to convey time (e.g., simple past tense for retelling, simple present for a science description) in shared language activities guided by the teacher and independently.

E066295F38A54B5C84A39298E5FC9C47.description: Use a growing number of verbs and verb types (e.g., doing, saying, being/having, thinking/feeling) in shared language activities guided by the teacher and independently.

21F1BCBDB55C4E88B425661AE20057E3.description: Use simple verb tenses appropriate for the text type and discipline to convey time (e.g., simple past for recounting an experience) in shared language activities guided by the teacher and with increasing independence.

F021B5BEDCE04911A26E15DCEC562437.description: Use frequently used verbs (e.g., go, eat, run) and verb types (e.g., doing, saying, being/having, thinking/feeling) in shared language activities guided by the teacher and with increasing independence.

AC7D49293FEE48F2A0B2E132C676B660.description: Apply understanding of how ideas, events, or reasons are linked throughout a text using a variety of connecting words or phrases (e.g., first/second/third, once, at the end) to comprehending texts and composing texts in shared language activities guided by the teacher, with peers, and independently.

661FE898A2624C47BCBE078A20479F02.description: Apply understanding of how ideas, events, or reasons are linked throughout a text using a growing number of connecting words or phrases (e.g., next, after a long time) to comprehending texts and composing texts in shared language activities guided by the teacher, collaboratively with peers, and with increasing independence.

720F7CE3EC6148F6A56A713DED804976.description: Apply basic understanding of how ideas, events, or reasons are linked throughout a text using more everyday connecting words or phrases (e.g., one time, then) to comprehending texts and composing texts in shared language activities guided by the teacher, with peers, and sometimes independently.

19DF8F496B92408896CEF9A15794C59A.description: Apply understanding of how different text types are organized predictably (e.g., a narrative text versus an informative text versus an opinion text) to comprehending texts and composing texts in shared language activities guided by the teacher, with peers, and independently.

E6C3B425C0C74948909EB18476F258EB.description: Apply understanding of how different text types are organized to express ideas (e.g., how a story is organized sequentially with predictable stages versus how an informative text is organized by topic and details) to comprehending texts and composing texts in shared language activities guided by the teacher, collaboratively with peers, and with increasing independence.

E1BE94AF269F4C559A44E97460AE4C4D.description: Apply understanding of how text types are organized (e.g., how a story is organized by a sequence of events) to comprehending and composing texts in shared language activities guided by the teacher, with peers, and sometimes independently.

7B8DC888D7864CD98B37FF1545FBD51D.description: Use a wide variety of general academic and domain-specific words, synonyms, antonyms, and non-literal language to create an effect (e.g., using the word suddenly to signal a change) or to create shades of meaning (e.g., The cat's fur was as white as snow) while speaking and composing.

3669CA33B3F14C24B391545FCD0AFBEC.description: Retell texts and recount experiences using increasingly detailed complete sentences and key words.

24B2F5D58857476494EA5CCEE2CB178D.description: Use a growing number of general academic and domain-specific words in order to add detail or to create shades of meaning (e.g., using the word scurry versus run) while speaking and composing.

6F048D7B23904634B976D934C52AACE2.description: Retell texts and recount experiences using complete sentences and key words.

268BA2C4FCE344EFBC72BD611734E699.description: Use a select number of general academic and domain-specific words to add detail (e.g., adding the word spicy to describe a favorite food, using the word larva when explaining insect metamorphosis) while speaking and composing.

6D5917F128B24E1B92A339C37295AB12.description: Retell texts and recount experiences using a select set of key words.

45BB5F05CF6B448B9EDF4E917819C5E2.description: Selecting and applying varied and precise vocabulary and language structures to effectively convey ideas

6331651EA2914EDFAD16914ABBAC2BD5.description: Offer opinions and provide good reasons with detailed textual evidence or relevant background knowledge (e.g., specific examples from text or knowledge of content).

E1F50D10CD88425290DFA9316F2B846C.description: Offer opinions and provide good reasons and some textual evidence or relevant background knowledge (e.g., paraphrased examples from text or knowledge of content).

4C4C665FF97C456F92082EEF320BAE43.description: Offer opinions and provide good reasons (e.g., My favorite book is X because X.) referring to the text or to relevant background knowledge.

AC762AA06C58455C84D0D14E94D0C79B.description: Supporting own opinions and evaluating others' opinions in speaking and writing

3FBB2ABFF85647B4B92F3BD7C29DE08B.description: Draw, dictate, and write to compose longer literary texts (e.g., story) and informational texts (e.g., an information report on dogs), collaboratively with an adult (e.g., joint construction of texts), with peers, and independently using appropriate text organization.

028FD85BDD624B9490D4EBA0AE609C54.description: Draw, dictate, and write to compose short literary texts (e.g., story) and informational texts (e.g., a description of dogs), collaboratively with an adult (e.g., joint construction of texts), with peers, and with increasing independence.

57DEAEA8B8794BD082DEE81818BD2831.description: Draw, dictate, and write to compose very short literary texts (e.g., story) and informational texts (e.g., a description of a dog), using familiar vocabulary collaboratively in shared language activities with an adult (e.g., joint construction of texts), with peers, and sometimes independently.

6CA9ED53EF3E41519E5751EB2E81A501.description: Composing/writing literary and informational texts to present, describe, and explain ideas and information, using appropriate technology

F7627AC73C0C42E1AD616BD0655C2075.description: Plan and deliver longer oral presentations on a variety of topics in a variety of content areas (e.g., retelling a story, describing a science experiment).

91CBC4F873FB4011B76045F17859B019.description: Plan and deliver brief oral presentations on a variety of topics (e.g., show and tell, author's chair, recounting an experience, describing an animal).

898109D7324B4B2BABFE4751FFDB9CCA.description: Plan and deliver very brief oral presentations (e.g., show and tell, describing a picture).

6908E9ED9E7B447FB4B38CCAC5A1A470.description: Expressing information and ideas in formal oral presentations on academic topics

8CE4BA4577EB4FB6AC34E9F66CB79746.description: Productive (creation of oral presentations and written texts)

B53591E998254B60AD82967C701E8612.description: Distinguish how multiple different words with similar meaning (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) produce shades of meaning and a different effect.

D88F905AC7F04D41A25345D10177E1DB.description: Distinguish how two different words with similar meaning (e.g., describing an action as walk versus march) produce shades of meaning and a different effect.

D6B2AA0DABA546F690BBF5544C4831F8.description: Distinguish how two different frequently used words (e.g., describing an action with the verb walk versus run) produce a different effect.

F121BB20CAA147F6BC0B6DE637A640D5.description: Analyzing how writers and speakers use vocabulary and other language resources for specific purposes (to explain, persuade, entertain, etc.) depending on modality, text type, purpose, audience, topic, and content area

0A559BF01E5F496EB5B1F5F1B9388823.description: Describe the language an author uses to present or support an idea (e.g., the vocabulary used to describe people and places), with prompting and light support.

835A22ED607149FE82253A46299EB782.description: Describe the language an author uses to present an idea (e.g., the adjectives used to describe a character), with prompting and moderate support.

77E460C81C55412CA488500D65F2E048.description: Describe the language an author uses to present an idea (e.g., the words and phrases used when a character is introduced), with prompting and substantial support.

614917D524F9497284909BB3EFC4E764.description: Evaluating how well writers and speakers use language to support ideas and opinions with details or reasons depending on modality, text type, purpose, audience, topic, and content area

F768282537DD4F2E933579C865717BCB.description: Describe ideas, phenomena (e.g., insect metamorphosis), and text elements (e.g., major events, characters, setting) using key details based on understanding of a variety of grade-level texts and viewing of multimedia, with light support.

B5E64EFB7E98479D92DC106237918FC7.description: Describe ideas, phenomena (e.g., how butterflies eat), and text elements (e.g., setting, characters) in greater detail based on understanding of a variety of grade-level texts and viewing of multimedia, with moderate support.

F5DCE4702337467F87481E6399CEBFF8.description: Describe ideas, phenomena (e.g., parts of a plant), and text elements (e.g., characters) based on understanding of a select set of grade-level texts and viewing of multimedia, with substantial support.

F284645D4F604F128302476E1048BCE1.description: Reading closely literary and informational texts and viewing multimedia to determine how meaning is conveyed explicitly and implicitly through language

6450F8D15901415BA4BCAE0C4E17C120.description: Demonstrate active listening to read-alouds and oral presentations by asking and answering detailed questions, with minimal prompting and light support.

B889540F7C1B4DD298AB55D0D6DC83F8.description: Demonstrate active listening to read-alouds and oral presentations by asking and answering questions with oral sentence frames and occasional prompting and support.

C6F6218B937945A98740CF6F5CD2F262.description: Demonstrate active listening to read-alouds and oral presentations by asking and answering yes-no and wh- questions with oral sentence frames and substantial prompting and support.

6608F5E2D05D4FD2812AF8B73037A33A.description: Listening actively to spoken English in a range of social and academic contexts

AE705820C47F419FB4074B6DD521C106.description: Interpretive (comprehension and analysis of written and spoken texts)

9D6421796BFC4F5CB9C7A52A4A049D40.description: Offer opinions in conversations using an expanded set of learned phrases (e.g., I think/don't think X. I agree with X, butâ€¦), as well as open responses, in order to gain and/or hold the floor or add information to an idea.

6A45A831548A461A806CA1D38F280BEA.description: Offer opinions in conversations using an expanded set of learned phrases (e.g., I think/don't think X. I agree with X), as well as open responses, in order to gain and/or hold the floor.

C3EB8EA686AF4692B49A6E3764F328E8.description: Offer opinions and ideas in conversations using a small set of learned phrases (e.g., I think X), as well as open responses.

EC47E70AB4BC422391D3143A5A8DF525.description: Offering and supporting opinions and negotiating with others in communicative exchanges

811F4BB70FD24EED8F177298CD22E172.description: Collaborate with the teacher and peers on joint composing projects of informational and literary texts that include a greater amount of writing (e.g., a very short story), using technology, where appropriate, for publishing, graphics, and the like.

AD45ABCA78DE475DA22F4474D3A1D8EA.description: Collaborate with the teacher and peers on joint composing projects of informational and literary texts that include some writing (e.g., short sentences), using technology, where appropriate, for publishing, graphics, and the like.

2C0EB584FEA34FAC86BE49BD65D011E5.description: Collaborate with the teacher and peers on joint composing projects of short informational and literary texts that include minimal writing (labeling with a few words), using technology, where appropriate, for publishing, graphics, and the like.

4D3C8E2D1C3F4AD69B227089ABEA3E6A.description: Interacting with others in written English in various communicative forms (print, communicative technology, and multimedia)

4CE6D5CE149443458A5062AC6D74054D.description: Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions by listening attentively, following turn-taking rules, and asking and answering questions.

6A1554CEC4F346C68DC74E8978B7CB46.description: Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions by listening attentively, following turn-taking rules, and asking and answering questions.

3EE712DAE53846749A648986D12D7177.description: Contribute to conversations and express ideas by asking and answering yes-no and wh- questions and responding using gestures, words, and simple phrases.

44E978DDA88F4A85B59A2843D74955BB.description: Exchanging information and ideas with others through oral collaborative conversations on a range of social and academic topics
